intro: Randia attopevensis, commonly known as the Attopevenis randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Randia attopevensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
